name: MarthaEDU
description: Martha EDU is a Jordanian/Syrian social enterprise that aims at uprooting illiteracy from the early stages of the lives of the d/Deaf and enabling children to grow with confidence and power.

SDGs.evidenceText: Literacy-boosting: Through a collaborative approach that allows children, parents and guardians to learn together. Building an educational experience which involves parents, guardians and others: Our content is produced with children in mind at every stage without promoting stereotypes and common biases.

Shifting the burden from women and girls: Through a product that can help families and communities take initiative and collaborate, instead of fully relying on the overwhelming, unpaid work women and girls are held responsible for because of certain gender-related misconceptions and norms
Filling the gap in public education: By preserving Jordanian Arabic Sign Language in the public domain as well as formal and informal education systems.

Peace-building: By substantially contributing to dialogue and creating the space and time for conversations in communities and households instead of the unfortunately common violent and inhumane practices against people with hearing disabilities. Advocating for D/deaf Children and People: We work with the D/deaf to develop our products and build platforms on which their stories reach more segments of society, decision-makers and international community.
